title: The Invention of the Microscope
description: Learn The Invention of the Microscope in one minute.

hook.text: A Dutch cloth merchant looked through a tiny lens and discovered an invisible world teeming with life.

buildup.text: Antonie van Leeuwenhoek built microscopes that magnified 270 timesâ€”far beyond anything available.

discovery.text: He saw bacteria, blood cells, and sperm for the first time. He called them 'animalcules.'

twist.text: Nobody believed him at first. The Royal Society sent a delegation to verify his claims.

climax.text: His discovery revealed that disease might come from tiny living thingsâ€”not bad air or curses.

punchline.text: The invisible world was there all along, waiting.

quiz.question: What did Leeuwenhoek discover with his microscopes?
options: Bacteria, blood cells, and other microorganisms
